name: Liberty Leading the People
description: Commemorates the July Revolution of 1830, showing the spirit of French liberty.

name: The Siege of La Rochelle
description: Depicts Cardinal Richelieu directing the siege of La Rochelle (1627–1628), a decisive moment in the consolidation of royal power under Louis XIII.

name: The Death of Marat
description: A martyr portrait of the French revolutionary Jean-Paul Marat.

name: Oath of the Horatii
description: A neoclassical masterpiece depicting Roman virtue and sacrifice.

name: La Grande Odalisque
description: An orientalist fantasy that challenged classical proportions.

name: The Raft of the Medusa
description: A powerful critique of French politics through a shipwreck disaster.

name: Starry Night Over the Rhone
description: Painted in Arles, France, capturing the night sky over the Rhone river.

name: Napoleon Crossing the Alps
description: Iconic propagandistic portrait of Napoleon leading his army through the Alpine pass toward Italy.

name: The Coronation of Napoleon
description: Monumental depiction of Napoleon’s coronation ceremony at Notre-Dame in Paris, emphasizing imperial grandeur.

name: Bonaparte Visiting the Plague Victims of Jaffa
description: Dramatic Napoleonic-era painting portraying Bonaparte as fearless and compassionate during the Egyptian campaign.
wiki_title: Bonaparte Visiting the Plague Victims of Jaffa

name: Napoleon at the Bridge of Arcole
description: Energetic image of Bonaparte carrying the flag during the Italian campaign, turning battle into legend.

name: Napoleon on the Battlefield of Eylau
description: A grand scene blending battlefield horror and imperial mercy after the Battle of Eylau (1807).

name: Cardinal Richelieu
description: A defining portrait of the powerful French statesman and cardinal, embodying authority and political discipline.
wiki_title: Armand Jean du Plessis de Richelieu

name: Triple Portrait of Cardinal Richelieu
description: Richelieu shown from three angles, likely used as a study for sculpture and as a statement of omnipresent power.
wiki_title: Armand Jean du Plessis de Richelieu

name: Portrait of Louis XIV
description: The ultimate royal image: Louis XIV in coronation robes, turning monarchy into theater and brand.

name: Equestrian Portrait of Charles I
description: Painted at the French court’s artistic orbit, this influential equestrian portrait helped define royal imagery in Europe.

name: Portrait of Madame Recamier
description: Elegant salon icon reclining in severe neoclassical calm, capturing the style and politics of post-Revolution Paris.

name: Madame Recamier
description: An alternative vision of the same famous sitter, with cool poise and linear refinement typical of Ingres.

name: The Execution of Lady Jane Grey
description: French Romantic history painting that popularized tragic royal drama with theatrical lighting and emotion.

name: Napoleon’s Farewell at Fontainebleau
description: A sentimental retelling of Napoleon’s farewell to the Imperial Guard, feeding 19th-century Napoleonic memory.

name: The Angelus
description: Two peasants pause for prayer at dusk, a rural icon of 19th-century France and the dignity of labor.

name: The Gleaners
description: A landmark Realist painting showing women collecting leftover grain, quietly political through everyday reality.

name: Luncheon on the Grass
description: Scandalous modern scene that shocked the Salon system and helped ignite modern art in France.

name: Olympia
description: A confrontational modern nude that challenged academic conventions and forced Paris to argue about art.

name: Impression, Sunrise
description: The painting that gave Impressionism its name, capturing Le Havre’s harbor in flickering atmosphere.

name: Dance at Le Moulin de la Galette
description: A joyful slice of Parisian life in Montmartre, painted with shimmering light and movement.

name: A Bar at the Folies-Bergere
description: A modern Paris nightlife scene with a mirror puzzle, blending glamour, alienation, and social observation.

name: Mont Sainte-Victoire (series)
description: Cezanne’s repeated studies of the Provençal mountain became a bridge from Impressionism to modern structure.

name: A Sunday Afternoon on the Island of La Grande Jatte
description: Pointillist masterpiece turning leisure into geometry and optical science on the banks of the Seine.
wiki_title: Un dimanche après-midi à l'île de la Grande Jatte

name: At the Moulin Rouge
description: A Belle Epoque nightlife portrait of Paris, capturing the sharp glow and strange psychology of cabaret society.

name: Hippolyte et Aricie
description: Opera that announced a new level of orchestral color and harmonic daring in French Baroque.

name: Symphonie fantastique
description: Hallucinatory program symphony that turned obsession into orchestral cinema before cinema existed.

name: Prélude à l'après-midi d'un faune
description: A landmark of musical Impressionism where melody drifts like perfume through warm air.

name: Boléro
description: A single rhythm and melody slowly intensify into a glittering mechanical crescendo.

name: Gymnopédies
description: Spare piano pieces that feel like soft lamps: simple, strange, and quietly modern.

name: Gloria
description: Sacred choral work balancing brightness and tenderness with sudden, playful turns.

name: Discovery
description: A sleek pop-electronic universe: hooks, vocoders, and neon nostalgia engineered to last.

name: Racine carrée
description: Sharp pop songwriting where dancefloor energy carries uncomfortable truths.

name: Les Misérables
description: Epic novel of justice, poverty, and moral transformation in post-revolutionary France.

name: Les Trois Mousquetaires
description: Swashbuckling adventure where friendship and politics duel in the same corridor.

name: Le Rouge et le Noir
description: Ambition, class, and hypocrisy under a microscope, with a protagonist built for friction.

name: Madame Bovary
description: A ruthless portrait of desire and boredom, written with surgical precision.

name: Les Fleurs du mal
description: Poetry that turns modern life into perfume, decay, and electric beauty.

name: L'Étranger
description: A spare, sunlit novel where meaning slips, and the world refuses to explain itself.

name: Du côté de chez Swann
description: Memory as architecture: one taste, and an entire world reconstructs itself.

name: Tartuffe
description: A razor comedy about hypocrisy, piety-as-costume, and domestic power games.

name: Le Voyage dans la Lune
description: Pioneering fantasy film that turned cinema into a magician’s stage.

name: La Grande Illusion
description: Humanist war film about class, borders, and fragile solidarity.

name: Les Quatre Cents Coups
description: New Wave coming-of-age story where freedom tastes like sea air and trouble.

name: À bout de souffle
description: A kinetic New Wave film that breaks rules with a grin and a cigarette.

name: Léon: The Professional
description: Stylized thriller pairing tenderness and violence in a neon-urban fable.

name: The Artist
description: A modern silent film homage to Hollywood’s transition era, made with French precision and charm.

name: Intouchables
description: Buddy drama-comedy built on contrast: class, bodies, humor, and unexpected care.

name: Le Fabuleux Destin d'Amélie Poulain
description: A whimsical Paris where small gestures become destiny engines.

name: Cathédrale Notre-Dame de Paris
description: Gothic masterpiece: flying buttresses, stained glass, and stone engineering turned into a skyline prayer.

name: Palais Garnier (Opéra de Paris)
description: Haussmann-era Paris in stone and gold: a Second Empire landmark born from the redesign of the city’s grand boulevards.

name: Eiffel Tower
description: Industrial iron becomes monument: a structure that turned engineering into a national icon.

name: Castel Béranger
description: Art Nouveau in Paris: whiplash curves, ironwork, and ornament that makes a building feel alive.

name: Palais de Chaillot
artist: Jacques Carlu / Louis-Hippolyte Boileau / Léon Azéma
description: Monumental Art Deco classicism facing the Eiffel Tower, built for the 1937 Paris International Exposition.

name: Le Penseur
description: Icône absolue de la sculpture moderne : la pensée devient tension du corps, comme si l’idée pesait physiquement.

name: Le Baiser
description: Amour sculpté à pleine chair : sensualité, douceur, et monumentalité intime à la fois.

name: Les Bourgeois de Calais
description: Héroïsme sans posture : un groupe de figures saisies dans la gravité, l’hésitation, et le courage nu.

name: La Valse
description: Deux corps pris dans un tourbillon : une danse qui ressemble à une tempête douce, tragique et élégante.

name: Le Départ des volontaires de 1792 (La Marseillaise)
description: Relief monumental de l’Arc de Triomphe : l’énergie nationale sculptée comme un cri de pierre.
